syllabus_info.syllabus_name: Cambridge International AS & A Level Physics 9702

learning_objectives.description: understand that fluctuations in count rate provide evidence for the random nature of radioactive decay
understand that radioactive decay is both spontaneous and random
define activity and decay constant, and recall and use A = λN
understand the exponential nature of radioactive decay, and sketch and use the relationship x = x₀e⁻λᵗ, where x could represent activity, number of undecayed nuclei or received count rate
